p: Although various microbial agents and antecedent events including various viral illnesses in adults and children have been associated with Guillain–Barré syndrome, Campylobacter jejuni, Epstein–Barr virus, cytomegalovirus, and Zika virus are among the most reported agents. There have been reports of an association between Guillain–Barré syndrome and Coronaviridae family viruses. For instance, during 2012 outbreak of Middle East respiratory syndrome (MERS) caused by MERS coronavirus (CoV) that shares many similar features with SARS-COV-2 a few cases of Guillain–Barré syndrome associated with infection had been reported( Kim et al., 2017).
